Articles.Content:
In the[last devnote before 1.0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116158-Devnote-Tuesday-Thank-you%21), Roverdude said this: "Lastly, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re taking bets on how long before the community discovers the resources easter egg we snuck in for you (IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m betting two months post launch). One hint: .ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a pretty large easter egg."

I still have not heard anything about what it could be. What do you guys think?

Roverdude confirmed a while back that the asteroid belt around Dres was the easter egg. We discovered it two days before launch, not two months after ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Yup, people found the Dresteroids a while back now.

...shoot. Discussion over, I guess. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Also, while on the subject on Dresteroids, what's the difference between them and normal asteroids? Are they bigger, smaller, rarer?
Just that they're close to Dres. And they may well randomly end up orbiting Dres. Now you have a reason to go to Dres?

> 
> Just that they're close to Dres. And they may well randomly end up orbiting Dres. Now you have a reason to go to Dres?

Pretty cool. I think they should've been big asteroids, perhaps kilometers wide (for variety's sake).
A class F asteroid.... \*shudders\* I can't even imagine...

> 
> A class F asteroid.... \*shudders\* I can't even imagine...

Only needs to be 26% larger in all dimensions to be twice as heavy - we may need ZZ class if we want them really big! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> A class F asteroid.... \*shudders\* I can't even imagine...

Someone needs to make a mod with huge asteroids

> 
> Someone needs to make a mod with huge asteroids

*(and some others)*

That would be a Gilly with simulated physics.
With the ability to mine fuel from asteroids, I'm waiting for the first screenshots from someone who's converted one into a ship and taken it on a grand tour.

> 
> A class F asteroid.... \*shudders\* I can't even imagine...

Slowteroids I imagine are not as quick as F asteriods.
So uh... Anyone win the bet?

> 
> A class F asteroid.... \*shudders\* I can't even imagine...

Still much smaller than comet 67/P...

> 
> ...shoot. Discussion over, I guess. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Not so fast, fella. Roverdude said it was the asteroids near Dres, true. But maybe he was just bluffing. Maybe this is all part of his evil, twisted schemes... ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

I mean, Rover's a pretty smart guy. How could he think that in 2 months not a single KSP player would travel to Dres and find dem roids? It's practically absurd, if you ask me. There must be something else..
